page.title: 11S.W.R.I.BUCHLYVIE
page.content: BUCHLYVIE W.R.I. was formed in{ {JULY,1919}the first in STIRLINGSHIRE and among the first in Scotland. At the first meeting it was decided that meetings be held on the second{TUESDAY of the month so that members could have the light of the moon to guide them as they travelled on foot or by pony and trap. Today that date is still 'Rural night' from September to May. The emblem selected was that of the{BARON OF BUCHLYVIE,}the famous Clydesdale stallion. A varied syllabus is presented to the members throughout the session, and may cover such topics as cookery, gardening, travel, art and craft and flower arranging. Members enter competitions, provide a Christmas party for the children and are involved in many activities which benefit the community. Membership is usually around{90 or 100}each year.
